3.
STEERING COMMITTEE AND TECHNICAL CO-ORDINATION COMMITTEE
The Parties agree to establish a “Steering Committee”, which will remain in force for the entire period of the JV, composed of two members for each
Company [e.g. Americo Cicchetti - To Be Nominated and Maurizio Chiriva – Gianluca Rotino], with the task of identifying the strategic objectives of the

perturbation.changed_text:
3.
STEERING COMMITTEE AND TECHNICAL CO-ORDINATION COMMITTEE
The Parties agree to establish a “Steering Committee”, which will remain in force for the initial two years of the JV, composed of two members for each
Company [e.g. Americo Cicchetti - To Be Nominated and Maurizio Chiriva – Gianluca Rotino], with the task of identifying the strategic objectives of the
collaboration and providing general guidelines.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Steering Committee remains in force for the entire period of the JV, but the changed text limits it to the initial two years. This creates ambiguity about the Steering Committee's role beyond two years, potentially leading to disputes regarding its authority and decisions.

perturbation.original_text:
6.
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND PROHIBITION OF TRANSFER TO THIRD PARTIES
The Parties undertake to promptly notify each other about the achievement of the Scope, as mentioned in point 2 (“the Results”) , that may be subject to
Industrial and Intellectual Property Rights, within 30 days from the achievement of such Results and to cooperate in the evaluation of the existence of the
necessary requirements for the patenting/registration of such Results.
The Industrial Property Rights on the Results, as well as the Intellectual Property Rights realized in the research activities covered by this JV, are due
jointly to the parties in equal shares (50% for each Party), without prejudice to the possibility of agreeing in writing, during the course of every specific
activity, about the modification of the respective shares of co-ownership, based upon the actual contribution of each of the Parties to the research
activities, and also without prejudice to the recognition of the intellectual rights due to each inventor pursuant to current legislation.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND PROHIBITION OF TRANSFER TO THIRD PARTIES
The Parties undertake to promptly notify each other about the achievement of the Scope, as mentioned in point 2 (“the Results”) , that may be subject to
Industrial and Intellectual Property Rights, within 90 days from the achievement of such Results and to cooperate in the evaluation of the existence of the
necessary requirements for the patenting/registration of such Results.
The Industrial Property Rights on the Results, as well as the Intellectual Property Rights realized in the research activities covered by this JV, are due
solely to Kiromic. Molipharma will not have any claim on the Intellectual Property Rights
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates notification within 30 days, while the modified text extends this to 90 days and changes the original joint ownership to only Kiromic.

perturbation.changed_text:
8.
DURATION
This JV Agreement shall become effective on the signing date and shall have a duration of * years, extendable for a further * years, unless notice of non-
renewal is sent six months before the natural expiry date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specified a one-year notice for non-renewal, but the modified text shortens this to six months. This introduces inconsistency regarding the required notice period for terminating the agreement, which may cause conflict if one party attempts to terminate with less than a year's notice but more than six months.
